sen.j: 親王・内親王の身位が「文仁親王」のように名の後に付され称呼の一部と見なされるのに対し、親王妃（及び王妃）は「文仁親王妃紀子」のように用いられる。
sen.e: While the title of a Shinno (Imperial Prince) or Naishinno (Imperial Princess by birth) is put before the name as in Imperial Prince Fumihito and considered to be part of the name, the title of a Shinnohi (Imperial Princess by marriage) is put both before and after the name as in Princess Kiko, the wife of Imperial Prince Fumihito

sen.j: 親王・内親王の表記にならって「紀子親王妃」のような逆順の表記をすることは、公式表記の観点からは誤用となる。
sen.e: Putting the title of a Shinnohi only before the name and calling her, for example, 'Princess Kiko' is considered officially incorrect.

sen.e: When a member of the Imperial Family (Naishinno or princess) marries to a Shinno and becomes a Shinnohi, she retains her maiden title as well as the title of Shinnohi until she becomes an empress.
